{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3481330,"name":"Harrison","username":"rackdev","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/c0e974/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T21:21:33.155Z","cooked":"

We are working on setting up our new project for 2025, and are getting setup to use MegaTag2 with Limelight. This seems to require the PoseEstimator within WPILib.

We generated our project through Phoenix Tuner X, and jumping around from the PostEstimator class I see there is an implementation that is CommandSwervePostEstimator- but no implementation of this anywhere in the generated project.

Hoping someone will have an idea where we can get this from or if there is something else we should be using for the new Phoenix 6.

Thanks

Since the Phoenix 6 Swerve API handles pose estimation internally, we have an addVisionMeasurement() API that functions in the same way as the one in WPILib’s PoseEstimator class. We demonstrate some basic vision integration in our SwerveWithPathPlanner example.

That makes sense and solved the original problem thank you!

We implemented it and began testing but noted that it seemed like the the robot was not updated to that location. Looking at the JavaDocs for SwerveDrivetrain#addVisionMeasurement it says we need to call SwerveDrivePoseEstimator#update every loop- I can’t seem to find where that would be implemented.

We call update internally in the SwerveDrivetrain odometry thread, which is how the non-vision portion of the pose estimator is updated (and how getState().Pose is updated even without vision).

If your robot isn’t being updated to the pose reported by vision (assuming the vision pose is valid), make sure that you’re providing a timestamp in the correct timebase (as demonstrated in our SwerveWithPathPlanner example). Most FRC vision libraries provide an FPGA timestamp, which needs to be converted to our timebase using Utils.fpgaToCurrentTime().
